title: Border vs TextureSlicer flickering

labels.name: A-Rendering
labels.description: Drawing game state to the screen

labels.name: A-UI
labels.description: Graphical user interfaces, styles, layouts, and widgets

body:
## Bevy version

14.2 and main

## \[Optional\] Relevant system information

Linux
## What you did

I modified the texture_slice example:
```
--- a/examples/ui/ui_texture_slice.rs
+++ b/examples/ui/ui_texture_slice.rs
@@ -73,6 +73,7 @@ fn setup(mut commands: Commands, asset_server: Res<AssetServer>) {
                             style: Style {
                                 width: Val::Px(w),
                                 height: Val::Px(h),
+                                border: UiRect::all(Val::Px(4.0)),
                                 // horizontally center child text
                                 justify_content: JustifyContent::Center,
                                 // vertically center child text
@@ -80,6 +81,7 @@ fn setup(mut commands: Commands, asset_server: Res<AssetServer>) {
                                 margin: UiRect::all(Val::Px(20.0)),
                                 ..default()
                             },
+                            border_color: BorderColor(Color::WHITE),
                             image: image.clone().into(),
                             ..default()
                         },
```
by adding a border to the buttons.

## What went wrong
I expected there to be a constant white border without flickering. 
Instead, the image and border seem to Z-fight. Mind you, I am not clicking just moving the mouse.
![Peek 2024-09-20 09-56](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9318f634-e9e4-4061-a440-33362cad6241)

You don't actually have to move the mouse, but it will "increase" the effect.

To me it seems as if the border is not correctly displaced and fights with the actual content in this case.
